Corpora.Description: These corpora are based on public domain literature selections provided by Project Gutenberg. These texts were chosen to test compression algorithms on human readable texts

SubCorpora.Label: Complete Text Corpus
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus contains the contents of all language specific literature corpora.

SubCorpora.Label: English Text
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus contains English language public domain books provided by Project Gutenberg.

SourceLinks.Label: The King James Bible
The Koran (Al-Qur'an) as translated by G. Margoliuth and J. M. Rodwell
The Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain
Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austin
Dracula by Bram Stoker
War and Peace by graf Leo Tolstoy
Beowulf
Metamorphosis by Franz Kafka

SubCorpora.Label: Chinese Text
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus contains Public domain books provided by Project Gutenberg. These books were chosen to create a test corpus of non-english text approximately 8 megabytes.

SourceLinks.Label: 紅樓夢 (Dream of the Red Chamber) by Xueqin Cao
水滸傳 (Outlaws of the Marsh) by Nai'an Shi
三國志演義 (Romance of the Three Kingdoms) by Guanzhong Luo
西遊記 (Journey to the West) by Cheng'en Wu
孫子兵法 (The Art of War) by Sunzi

SubCorpora.Label: French Text
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus contains Public domain books provided by Project Gutenberg. These books were chosen to create a test corpus of non-english text approximately 8 megabytes.

SourceLinks.Label: Du côté de chez Swann (Swann's Way) by Marcel Proust
Les liaisons dangereuses (Dangerous Liaisons) by Choderlos de Laclos
A l'ombre des jeunes filles en fleurs - Première partie (In the Shadow of Young Girls in Flower - Part One) by Marcel Proust
Voyage au Centre de la Terre (Journey to the Center of the Earth) by Jules Verne
Vingt mille Lieues Sous Les Mers — Complete (20,000 Leagues Under the Sea — Complete) by Jules Verne

Corpora.Label: Random Data
Corpora.Description: These corpora were chosen to stress compression algorithms with incompressible or nearly incompressible data

SubCorpora.Label: Random Binary Data
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is created as a single 10 megabyte file of pseudorandom binary data.

SubCorpora.Label: Random ASCII Text
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is created as a single 10 megabyte file of pseudorandom ASCII text.

Corpora.Label: jQuery
Corpora.Description: This corpus is composed of current source code for the popular javascript library jQuery. It was chosen as an example of a large repository of computer source code in order to test how the utilities handle somewhat structured data.

Corpora.Label: Images
Corpora.Description: This corpus is composed of images from NASA and are designed to test compression algorithms against different image formats

SourceLinks.Label: The Omega Nebula, STScI-2002-11
The Hubble Deep Field, STScI-1996-01

SubCorpora.Label: Tiff Formatted Images
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is comprised of several TIFF formatted images

SubCorpora.Label: Bitmap Formatted Images
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is comprised of several BMP formatted images

SubCorpora.Label: GIF Formatted Images
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is comprised of several GIF formatted images

SubCorpora.Label: JPEG Formatted Images
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is comprised of several JPEG formatted images

SubCorpora.Label: PNG Formatted Images
SubCorpora.Description: This corpus is comprised of several PNG formatted images

Compressors.Label: Compress-Archive
Compressors.Description: The Compress-Archive cmdlet uses the built in Windows zip compressor that is also used by Explorer when sending selections to compressed folders.
7Zip is a popular open-source archiving program supporting a large variety of archive formats and achieves good compression ratios.

Compressors.Label: Posix based compressors provided by the cygwin project
Compressors.Description: 7Zip is a popular open-source archiving program supporting popular Linux archive formats.
Compressors.Command: 7z.exe a -ttar archive.tar $Source; 7z.exe a @($Arguments) $Target archive.tar; Remove-Item archive.tar

Compressors.Label: WinRAR
Compressors.Description: WinRar is a popular closed-source archiving program supporting a large variety of archive formats and achieves good compression ratios.

Compressors.Label: Popular Linux compressors provided by the cygwin project
Compressors.Disabled: These tests are currently disabled as 7Zip includes tests for these formats that run in significantly less time and produce similar results. You can run these tests by passing the -IncludeDisabled switch to the test script.

Compressors.Label: Null Compressor
Compressors.Description: The null compressor performs no compression and serves as a baseline to compare other test compressors against
